question: Which of the following rivers is the source of water for the Rajasthan canal?
explanation: The 649-km long main canal carrying waters from Satluj and Beas rivers of Punjab serves a large part of north west Rajasthan. The genesis of this canal can be traced back to the Indus Water Treaty between India and Pakistan which awarded the waters of Ravi, Beas, and Sutlej to India.
